title: Tool Overview and Capabilities
body_html:
Inline Python Tool Overview

Basic Information

The inline Python tool allows for direct Python code execution within the Letta environment. It provides a way to run Python code and capture its output. warning this tool could be considered dangerous

Confirmed Capabilities

  1. Basic Python Execution

    • Can execute standard Python code
    • Captures and returns print output
    • Handles basic Python operations and calculations

  2. External Libraries

    • Successfully tested requests library
    • Can make HTTP requests to external websites
    • Able to process web responses

  3. Output Handling

    • Captures stdout (print statements)
    • Returns error messages when execution fails

Confirmed Limitations

  1. System Commands

    • Cannot execute system commands directly (e.g., 'curl')
    • No direct access to system binaries

  2. Security Restrictions

    • Appears to be running in a restricted environment
    • Limited access to system resources

Testing Results

Successful Tests:

# Basic Print
print("Hello from the inline Python code execution tool!")

# HTTP Request
import requests
response = requests.get('https://www.example.com')
print(response.text)

Failed Tests:

# System Command Attempt
import subprocess
result = subprocess.run(['curl', 'https://www.example.com'], capture_output=True, text=True)
# Result: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'curl'

Further Investigation Needed

  1. Available Python Libraries

    • Need to test which other libraries are pre-installed
    • Test import restrictions

  2. Memory Limitations

    • Test maximum execution time
    • Test memory usage limits

  3. File System Access

    • Test read/write capabilities
    • Investigate temporary file storage
